pullRequest.body:
Drop classes that mix `OrderHomClass` with algebraic hom classes.

---

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7920008451/job/21622031789)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7920008451/job/21622032085)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7920008451/job/21622031487)
It's a bit weird to put this in the `OrderMonoidHomClass` namespace given that such a class doesn't exist anymore, but I don't have a better suggestion.

How about
```suggestion
def FunLike.toOrderMonoidHom [OrderHomClass F α β] [MonoidHomClass F α β] (f : F) :
```
Let me do it for all bundled homs at once.

Can you add a note explaining what happened to the class? That is, it's not longer necessary because we just use two separate classes. It would be nice to centralize that comment somehow, maybe by grouping all the `#noaligns` in this file that occur for the same reason.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: drop some `*HomClass`es
